intro: Guatteria hilariana var. verruculosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often covered in small, raised bumps or tubercles, giving it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a dark purple drupe, which contains a single seed and is an important food source for various wildlife species.
